intro: Bartonia pubescens, commonly known as the downy bartonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and leaves, as well as its showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Bartonia pubescens is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
